p: In total, 63 main compounds (99.32%) were found in Zanthoxylum acanthopodium essential oil, including estragole (15.46%), eucalyptol (10.94%), Î²-caryophyllene (5.52%), cis-linalool oxide (3.76%), cis-limonene oxide (3.06%). Both whole essential oil and its main compounds (estragole and eucalyptol) showed significant larvicidal activity. The results revealed that Zanthoxylum acanthopodium essential oil could be further developed as a potential agent to control the larvae of malaria mosquito.
